description:
There are 3 things I require of any wine bar: 

1. Cute atmosphere
2. Good wine 
3. Snacks. There *must* be snacks. 

Fig & Thistle checks all 3 of my must haves and then some. They have a cute name, they are in a good location, great service... this list goes on!

Fig & Thistle is one of my favorite spots to meet friends and grab a glass of wine + popcorn.  Check it out if you love wine and an adorable spot to relax!
author: Kelly F.

description:
Very cute little wine shop! We went on a Saturday evening before a show at Davies Hall. This place was packed (with a small group even sitting, chatting, and sipping on the stoop!) but we luckily found a couple of seats at the bar along the wall. I had a rose, and my husband had some variety of wine wine neither of us has heard of - both were very, very good. 

They offer a few tempting small bites along with a selective menu of wines. Enough variety to be interesting, but not a library of selection.

The service was great - especially for such a packed little shop. Once we swooped in on our little spot, one of the staff behind the bar immediately came over and cleared the bar for us. Service at the bar was very helpful and fast.

The ambiance was inviting and cool, even with the crowd. The decor is thoughtful and sweet. There is a little couch in an old bunk bed frame if you're lucky to snag it!

We we're lucky to find a spot even for 2 people here - that's the only downside. If you're willing to wait for a spot, this is a chill place to check out!
author: Lauren S.

description:
Cute hidden wine bar, cute decor, not much seating. Only really wine selections and some select beer / cider selections, but overall quite limited beverage selection. 

Good for 2-3 people gatherings, not good for large groups.
author: Cynthia X.

description: Such a cute and cozy little wine bar! We were here for a wine tasting of a small winery. Our only complaint was we got some bread with butter that had big salt crystals sprinkled on top, interesting idea but did not work. It was hard to scoop a consistent amount of salt & the crystals were oddly crunchy, overall created a weird flavor.
author: Victoria S.

description:
One of the best wine bars in the city!!! Definitely a diamond in the rough. The owners are super cool and welcoming. Bottles of wine are comparable, and let's not forget tasty!!!

Ambiance = A+
Wine selection = unparalleled
Location, location, location!!!

Trust me, just visit!!!! 

Mic drop!!!
author: Ali R.

description:
First time to Fig&Thistle and I have to say I loved it. I live right around the corner and have been meaning to stop by for ages. A friend and I ordered the vermouth flight and a red wine flight, at $15 each. The vermouth flight especially was a really good deal, and we accompanied it with some really tasty olives and cheese. I thought the cheese portions were generous by charcuterie standards and all were very tasty. 

A really special thing about this place is their cozy, homey vibe. I forgot to take a photo, but we sat in what is literally a transformed wooden bunk bed. Each table is different, and you kind of feel like you're drinking in this super cozy log cabin somewhere far away from the city. It's actually really amazing how well they manage to pull off such an intimate space without being too kitschy or tacky. 

I will say that the service was not great/ was confusing. When we ordered our two flights, it was at the bar, and we had to carry them over - which was fine.  However, we didn't seem to be able to get water and it took a really long time for us to order the additional food, as they seemed very understaffed and it was unclear whether we should flag a server down or get their attention at the bar. Also the two servers were very selectively friendly, smiling and chatting with certain patrons while ignoring others (us and a few other people) who were trying to get their attention. This felt really strange for such a small quiet bar, as it shouldn't have been so hard to order. That being said, I'd still come back. 

The prices were super reasonable and it was so nice! Definitely would enjoy going on another date here.
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
Great wine selection! Their Zucchini salad was delicious.

I like coming here for drinks before a concert/ events at the symphony hall.
author: Christina L.

description:
My third stop on an impromptu bar crawl in Hayes Valley. I had met up with a girlfriend after dinner and we decided to explore the area. Using mainly Yelp to pick our spots, we decided to visit Fig & Thistle on Wednesday, July 12th around 10pm. We ordered at the bar and then found a seat on the lower part of the bunk bed in the corner. (At least I think it was a bunk bed. My time here is a little hazy.)

*The Other Man 2016 Carbonic Zinfandel, Mendocino ($14 glass)
*Purity 2014 Old Vine Carignan, Antioch, Contra Costa County ($13 glass)

I wasn't familiar with any of the wines, so I just picked two glasses based on the names. One of them was very light, so I didn't enjoy it as much. I'm not familiar with carbonic wines. Honestly, I'm not even sure what that means, but judging from the year, I'm guessing the other man was the lighter one. We had been drinking cocktails at our two previous stops, so this was definitely not the full bodied and bold wine we wanted. The purity was good though. Not sure if we thought it was good just in comparison, but we enjoyed that glass.

Very cute neighborhood bar. The atmosphere was dimly lit, but cozy. I vaguely recall there being hanging lights around the bed? Like the white Christmas lights you wrap around banisters, etc. Very pretty and an little romantic. Definitely a fun third stop.
author: Elena N.

description: Nice tasting room just off Gough Street, a hidden side street. Quaint and rustic wine bar. Friendly wait staff. Sit at a table or up to the bar.
author: Maureen K.

description:
Super cute/hip wine bar in Hayes Valley with a cool bunk bed spot to sit. Pretty small so you may have to wait to grab a table. They have some light bites (i.e charcuterie board) but don't expect to eat a real meal here. 

I gotta say, it was pretty expensive - my glass of wine was $15. Still a cute, cozy, tucked away spot. I enjoyed it and will be back!
author: Ilana B.

description:
This place is so cute! It's a tiny space inside and feels very quaint, yet hipster -- like being in an Anthropologie store, but with wine. 

Service is great; the bartenders were helpful, gave good recommendations and managed a busy evening deftly. We got wine flights that were reasonably priced at $15, and the glasses in the flight were served in cute little wooden boxes which made drinking it a fun experience. We didn't try any of the food but they did have a small menu of light bite type fare available until 9:30pm. 

This would be a nice place for a date or for catching up with friends. My only gripe is that it's loud -- both the music and general volume level in the space make having a conversation a bit of a struggle. All in all, this is a great wine bar option in SF!
author: Christine G.

description: Such a great little wine bar in Hayes Valley. Very cozy space, great wine selection and nice go withs to snack on. Stopped in and relaxed on a cozy couch and enjoyed a lovely dry Poe rose. We got a cheese and charcuterie plate that was really yum, had some marcona almonds, cherry jam, the sweetest plums I've ever eaten along with bread cheese and meats. A perfect spot to stop and sip the wine and let the rest of the world go by for a while.
author: Karen R.

description: Fun little spot! Not a ton of seating, but adorable venue with a solid wine menu. You order at the bar and sit wherever is open, so it could be smart to get there early and post up. Definitely recommend for a couple glasses of wine.
author: Amelia Q.

description:
Stopped by here with a girlfriend on a Friday nite.
Def. love the ambiance. The space is nice and fit for a date or for a night out with friends. Love this wine bar' will be back for sure. The music maybe a tiny tad loud!
author: Mary N.

description:
Love love love!!! Cutest little wine bar in Hayes, the interior is cozy yet chic. Great spot for a date, meet with small group of friends. It isn't huge so you wouldn't want to bring a big group. I like that it's less rowdy and hectic as other places in Hayes. The staff is really attentive and quick! They did have some light bite options which is good while you're guzzling away glasses of vino. 

Wines are reasonably priced and pours are generous. Probably one of the best wine bars in SF bc of it cute and quaint atmosphere. Can't wait to be back!
author: Hetal P.

description:
Nina Y. and I already had drinks at Brass Tacks and dinner at a Mano, but we were in the mood for a night cap. It's been awhile since we caught up, admittedly. This place was smaller than I thought. It's located down a side alley, and I think if it was crowded, it would totally ruin the whole "secret rendezvous" vibe that it gives off. The little romantic alcove with twinkle lights inside the bar accentuates this theme. 

We chose seats at the barstools opposite from the entrance and adjacent to the bar. We ordered glasses of wine, which were MASSIVE, and holy moly they were GENEROUS pours. Perhaps it was because we visited so close to closing time, and they needed to get rid of their wine. Who knows? But anyways, the bartender was friendly and kept to himself. We had our own private conversation, as did the rest of the customers. It was a nice, chill place. I would love to come here again if I was in the area!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Dropped by with my friend from LA. It's in this alley and I got a bit lost finding it. Fig & Thistle is definitely tiny. We were there pretty early before getting dinner elsewhere. I do agree with everyone else that it's super cute. The wine menu wasn't too much of a variety. Not a lot of light bites. Regardless, if you're looking for a cute wine bar, this is the place. Get the wine flight and when it's crowded, the servers can have a bit of a difficult time getting your drinks to you.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Super cute and super small bar serving wine, beer and ciders.

It's a great way to start the evening! 

Cheers!
author: Charlie B.

description:
Pretty good, as far as wine bars go. It's nice and quiet, very cozy, low-key. A pleasant, intimate atmosphere created by well-spaced seating and subdued lighting. 

I had a reasonably good red wine -- "Horse & Plow" -- which was very dark & sweet.
author: John L.

description:
Small and cozy with just the right noise level and ambience without being too pretentious or over the top. Very small so not good for big groups, but I met up with three of my girlfriends for a chill night and we were happy to get the little couch area. It was definitely nice to catch up at a bar that was busy enough to maintain a vibe, but not too crowded where you can't hold a conversation cause it's too loud. That's pretty rare to find.

We split a bottle which was decently priced (for Hayes valley/SF standards) and had some homemade pickles which were well plated but mediocre tasting. Somehow there is real pickled vegetable competition in the city..!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Similar to what others have said - it's super cozy, a little hidden on a side street.  Very San Francisco - cozy and romantic. Service was fine.  Music was too loud and didnt fit with the rest of the vibe.

I had a glass of cabernet franc, which was fine but nothing special. My sister had a glass of rose, and something was wrong with it.  Tasted like water.  It was too much effort to complain and we only stayed ~ 20 minutes before dinner.  

There are too many other places nearby (like Arlequin wine merchant) that have really excellent wine to make me want to return here.
author: Holly P.

description: Officially my favourite wine bar in SF. Came here last night and stayed until 10pm. I ended up getting a flight of three red wines and loved it. The ambiance is super cute and just chill. You can have a conversation without having to shout and it isn't a pretentious bar soooo it's perfect!
author: Mira B.

description: This is my favorite post-work wine spots Hayes Valley and one of the few places that you can have a conversation without screaming over a ton of people (at least until fri/sat nights). It's a tiny space with an intimate vibe and the bartenders are great!
author: Morgan G.

description: Great wines, good service, and a cool atmosphere. The place is a bit small so it's hit or miss if you can find a good place to hang out, but if you can it's definitely a good pre or post-dinner spot to grab some good wine. If you aren't sure what you like, the bartenders can usually give you a good recommendation. I really enjoy this place but wish the prices were slightly cheaper given the pour sizes, hence the missing star.
author: Natasha M.

description:
Fig and Thistle has become my new favorite, post-performance hangout spot in the Civic Center/Hayes Valley area. It's located in a small alley/side street off of Gough Street, and the relatively secluded location helps highlight the intimate vibe of this wine bar. Whenever I enter, I think this place would be great for a romantic date or if someone was hoping to have some great wine and conversation with old friends. 

The dark wood accents and subtle lighting gives this place a warm and inviting ambience, and the wine I've had here has been top notch. I once tried a few glasses of a red wine varietal called Zweigelt, and the sharp, fruity notes were quite memorable.  Fig and Thistle also offers small bites like olives and bread, but I have not tried their food and therefore can't comment on the quality. I would definitely recommend stopping by if you're in the area!
author: Keith H.

description: Such a cute and cozy place. Bunk bed makes the atmosphere really cozy. Good wine selection. No table service, you have to order at the bar, but the service is amazing. Try it out.
author: Julie D.

description: Wow- I'm so glad I stumbled upon this Speakeasy type wine bar tucked in the middle of Hayes Valley. It was such a cool vibe, and had a great beer and wine selection. My husband and I loved the coziness of this place, but it was pretty crowded when we went on a random Saturday. Highly recommend going if you can get a seat and enjoy a nice glass of wine!
author: Carol Ann V.

description:
Fig & Thistle is so cute it makes me want to puke.

Actually it's just a hipster wine bar that's kind of expensive for what it is. Bars like this are a dime a dozen these days and this place does not stand out to me at all. The wine list was fine. The staff were great. The bathrooms were nice. The little couch bunkbed seating was very cute. 

If you have a visitor in town this is a fantastic place to take them. It's very lively and the crowd is nice. But if you're looking for a unique experience get the hell out of Hayes Valley.
author: Alex K.

description: This is a neat wine bar in a side street within Hayes Valley. The venue seems small but intimate, definitely a good place for a date. The Cabernet I had was solid, I definitely plan on coming back!
author: Clayton B.

description:
Angel asked me what I wanted to drink... I definitely was unsure, cause I didn't wanna swim in the fruit forward pond of old vine Lodi zins yet again. 

I had just come back from Croatia- land of olive skinned, seafood- loving, red- wine making lovelies and I remember drinking varietals I had never even dreamed of (plavic, etc).

Angel went into the wine refrigerator and PULLED OUT A PLAVIC LIKE NO BIG DEAL. Like, who does that? Why is she so good to us? She gave us some tasting points and made sure WE HAD OUR FILL. 

Also, our next glass I was kinda feeling myself and asked for "something cute." She poured us a minerally Cab that she called "tough cute, not too adorable." YAAAAAAAS KWEEEEEN!

So, I'm not saying you should bug Angel about somewhat esoteric wines, especially when you go to such a well- cruated California wine bar. What I'm saying is, Angel is an angel. #bestsommevz
author: Chris L.

description: I would like to mention that the rating has nothing to do with the service at all - the bartenders in the back are super friendly and personable. BUT, I cannot give it more than two stars as both times I've come here have been really disappointing. First time here was on a first date and it's really intimate and quite cute - it was a really hot day in SF though and everyone was pretty much sweating in close quarters. EEK. We both ordered wine flights letting the bartender pick the three options - all of them weren't very good, but whatever maybe I should've been more picky. Regardless, the list of wines isn't very extensive so the next time I came here with a friend I decided to pick the wines. Again, how can you go wrong with a nice pinot noir right? Guess again, you can apparently. Overall, the pours aren't super heavy, the list isn't extensive and the intimate quarters can be too intimate at times so definitely is a pass for me.
author: Anh Thu P.

description: Very cute wine bar in a small alley in Hayes Valley. The atmosphere is small and perfect for a glass with a friend! The prices are a little high, but the aesthetic makes up for it. It was pretty crowded when I arrived and was lucky enough to grab a table as people got up to leave.
author: Ali W.

description: Nice little wine bar hidden in an alley. Packs up quick. They have wine flights so I'm sold.
author: Gordon L.

description: I've been to this cozy spot a couple of times and have never been disappointed! It's the perfect place for an evening drink or a happy hour catch up with you girlfriends, and I love the creativity in both their wine list and appetizers. Check out their events as well - I went to the tasting they hosted with Sans Wine Co. last night, and it was fun to try a new label and chat with the winemakers.
author: Holly L.

description: Always a must to visit and and enjoy a great rose with friends. Music is amazing as well!
author: Justine J.

description: We love this place - it's small and cozy and a little bit hidden which makes it feel special! Great collection of wines and a few nice beers too! We have never had any of the nibbles but they also look great (especially the cheeses)! Perfect place for couples and small groups.
author: Lauren A.

description: After leaving a bar full of snotty hipster 20 somethings spoiling to be abusive to people who appear older than themselves - we found ourselves at a much more pleasant venue where we were greeted, treated with respect and had friendly, respectful interactions with other patrons in a very nicely arranged converted victorian space.  Super relaxing, reasonable prices on the wines by the glass and a really great selection.  I look forward to returning here -- excellent hospitality!
author: Jenn C.

description: The minute I walked up to the door, I was intrigued by the level of intimate ambiance this place has. I appreciated the lighting and just the atmosphere of it all. This place is located on Ivy street; which I believe is a smaller street/alley and you will miss it if you're driving. I was lucky to have a local recommend this place to me and I walked. They have a nice wine selection and a few beer selection too. I was in the mood for a nice glass of wine and had their pinot grigio. I would imagine this place being very busy after 9 pm. I strolled in a little after 7:30 pm and had plenty of seat options to choose from. Sitting at the bar was a treat because the bartender lady was a delight. She was very helpful with the selections. I am looking forward to visiting this gem again. This time with friends.
author: Hailey V.

description: This is a cute hideaway. Friendly environment and great wine and nibble selections. I highly recommend this place as a start to the evening before dinner or a show.
author: Christine J.

description:
Very cute wine bar in the heart of Hayes Valley. 
They have a tasting menu for $15 you can try 3 flights of wine. 

Very loud. Not my favorite, but good quick service and small bar bites make this place perfect spot to start your evening.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Something about this place reminds me of Beacon Hill, Boston. If you don't believe it, just google Beacon Hill Boston and see the images of the street. I ought to know. I spent a bit of time there last year and had gotten to know all the neighbors after my morning coffee and breakfast at the Paramount. 

After City Arts and Lectures (it was John Waters, very good), the evening was winding down and one could very quickly conclude that Thursday night in San Francisco is a ghost town. One would be right. At 9 PM the place is nearly deserted. Suits me just fine. A large table was waiting for me. So I ordered the mix plate of charcuterie and cheese. As I have finally reached the cross road of white vs. red, I have finally gotten on the band wagon of white. The staff recommends a Portuguese white as it's more stone fruity. He's right, I liked it more than the Rose from Sonoma.

The bunk bed is odd, it pretty much faces directly at me from where I'm sitting. It was empty for a little bit then a couple, in their 20s, showed up. Looking around, this is a bit of a millennial crowd, more on the sophisticated side of the spectrum, given the attire and the mannerism, but still, very young.

The bar serves a fairly good amount of beer on tap, suitably so, to serve the aforementioned clientele. 

It's tucked away, right next to my last summer's crush, Monsieur Benjamin. For people like me who wants a little privacy, while enjoying a glass of wine, it's perfect. Find that big table in the middle that faces out, you can do quite a bit of people watching, without getting the feeling that you are being watched.
author: Victoria E.

description: Perfect low key hidden gem in SF Hayes Valley! The charcuterie mixed plate was delicious! I am already craving it and craving the vibe. Super relaxed especially if you get lucky to sit and chill in the bunk bed with a friend or a date! Perfection to the max! Coming back soon! The lady bartender was super friendly and sweet. Thanks for a great first experience
author: Alessandra E.

description: What a cute place. Dimly lit, but in a way where you can still see the beauty of the person sitting across from you. The bartenders are great, will let you taste a wine before you commit yourself to a whole bottle. Come here after a symphony show, or maybe before. It's also hidden from the main road, and you're sure to impress anyone with your insider knowledge of the neighborhood. This place might as well be in Paris!
author: Anthony G.

description: We found this place unassuming and a great place to have a few drinks and unwind. They did run out of a few things throughout the night, however it was a great experience.
author: Ron B.

description: Love the ambiance and wine. Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable abt their products and offer good choices. I will be be back to spend many more cozy evenings w/friends or solo.
author: TJ S.

description:
Five starts for interior and ambiance, three stars for wine/beer selection. 

This was my first visit and I came with a couple of friends. No problem finding a spot accommodating three of us by a window. The ambiance is lovely--great decor, cozy feel, not a huge spot. 

The wine/beer selection is just ok--I was surprised by the limited offerings of both. 

We didn't try any of the bar bites, but they looked lovely! 

Next time, I'll try a wine flight versus a glass. 

The good: great spot for intimate conversations.
The bad: limited selection. 

But overall, definitely coming back!
author: Amanda B.

description: I was really looking forward to trying out Fig & Thistle tonight and trying the wine flight plus cheese & charcuterie plate. The bar was full unfortunately but was giving a menu and told once I was ready to order from the bar. The women working was nice but really seemed to not care much about the service I was getting.  I wasn't told anything about the wine or cheese besides me asking the fee simple questions of what kind or cheese/wine they came with. I wasn't given any depth of what I was going to be enjoying.  I've worked in the service industry for over ten years (fine dining included) so I know what should be expected of those who work in this field. Sad to say it was nowhere to be found tonight.  It's a real shame because it could of been a great experience but instead I felt cheated and regretful of spending my money there.
author: Christine T.

description: A really quiet and intimate space. Great collection of wines at a reasonable price. Perfect date night spot!
author: Nimeela D.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night and it wasn't too crowded.  It's a pretty cozy and intimate bar with dim lighting.  An assortment of seating including bar seating, tables and one loungey sofa type setup.  Limited menu of wines and beers but my wine was good.  A nice place for a date or tête à tête.
author: Vivian W.

description:
The space is nice and they have an interesting wine and beer selection at decent prices, but those decent prices go right out the door when your bartender pre-selects the tip percentage on their Square register when you close your tab before she turns it around for you to sign.  She just poured wine and beer, she did NOT mix a fancy cocktail, and yet, I ended up paying enough tip to buy a couple more beers.

By the way, is that even legal??
author: Kazu O.

description:
This is a nice place. It's cozy. Has decent wine. Cool hidden location. They did run out of food at 10 PM but that's not the reason I am writing this review. One of their bartenders, Chazz, is single handedly earning this place this awful review. 

We were a big group and from the beginning of the night Chazz was rude to everyone, but we ignored it given that we were having a good time and didn't want to bother ourselves with a rude staff member. However at one point a glass of wine spilled on my wife and I needed napkins to dry it up. Chazz refused to give me enough napkins and simply kept repeating that "he can't give me all the napkins at the bar!" I was simply asking for a few napkins to clean up the mess, which is why the bar has napkins after all. I ended up taking whatever napkins he gave me and rushed back to our table to clean up. [side note: there was another staff member behind the bar who was great. He brought over a stain remover to help me remove the wine from my wife's jacket].  Meanwhile Chazz walks over and condescendingly asks whether I need more napkins and then walks away with a smirk. 

I get it. Everyone could have a bad day and may need a break. On a bad day, you may not want to smile at a customer or provide a great service, but going out of your way to walk over to your customers' table to insult them needs a whole different mindset. In no industry that is acceptable and it's especially not acceptable in the hospitality industry.
author: Mike B.

description: After a girl's dinner at Babu Ji, we came here for a drink on a Friday night. It was crowded but we were able to get a pour quickly and sneak our way to seats. I would not come here on a Friday night, but this would be a great date spot. Maybe a second or 3rd date because it's pretty intimate and has a very romantic setting.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description:
I'll start with the positive: this is an adorable wine bar with a very cozy and romantic atmosphere. Perfect for a happy hour date. The wine is delicious and the cheese plate is fantastic. Service is attentive and quick. 
Now for the negative: this bar is unnecessarily expensive. For a happy hour with two people, we were absolutely floored to find that our bill amounted to over $90. We had two glasses of wine each, and shared a very skimpy cheese board. 
Although I'd love to say I will return, the wine and ambience are simply not good enough to warrant these prices.
author: Kerry R.

description:
Love this charming little bar nestled in Hayes!

Fig and Thistle has an old speakeasy sort of feel, hidden on a small side street around the corner from One Sushi. They serve a variety of wines and beers (none on tap, all from a bottle/can) and a charchuterie plate with some fruit and bread. 

Tip: Credit cards accepted.
author: Jess C.

description: Tiny tiny place so not very many seats. Went for wine and cheese... The cheese plate was really disappointing as it was really small and not a great selection.
author: Mallika M.

description:
Lovely hidden spot in Hayes Valley. I would highly recommend this place to anyone to meet up a friend or a date spot. They are very knowledgeable about the wines and also the cheese plate is decent. 

If you happen to go there on a Monday night, there is a tarot card reader. :)
author: Amit H.

description:
Talk about a shoebox of a wine bar, but this place is adorable! Fig & Thistle is in a great location in Hayes - close to many other fun restaurants and bars, so regardless of weather you're starting or ending your night here, you have plenty of options nearby for food or drink. We came in with another couple and luckily, were able to grab one of the larger tables. There were probably only three options that would have fit our group of 4. Good wine and beer variety plus a few light bite options - cheese, charcuterie, and the like. I always appreciate the option to order a flight - always a good excuse to sample away and typically better value than ordering a single glass.

Definitely a fun spot to grab a glass of wine or beer. Just beware the tight quarters and limited seating.
author: Brianna M.

description:
Average wine bar that goes from charming and intimate on weekdays to crowded and noisy on the weekends. Love the bunk bed and sweet decor but the wine is hit or miss.

P.S. I really don't think wine bars should be allowed to serve wine in tumblers since your hands are just going to ruin the temp, especially when the bar is packed and your palms are getting sweaty! That's my only pretentious qualm, otherwise a cute spot that is a-OK.
author: Alyssa Y.

description: Awesome vibe and a great selection of solid wines. A fun place to go to for a casual glass after work - also, a perfect date spot. Four stars because the service isn't that great, but it's a bar, so who cares? Come for the vibes and great wines.
author: SR S.

description:
This little place gets quite LOUD on a Saturday evening, but it's a charming space (used to be a therapist office) with bar, table and bench seating.  Make use of the front steps too because this place gets packed.  

I would give this place 4 stars, but the red wine selection was not that great (Sangiovese was sour and frankly undrinkable, the Tempranillo was a-ok, not much to write home about), and being a WINE bar, I expect more.  The charcuterie and cheese combo plate was quite lovely though with two kinds of cheese, two kinds of meats, marcona almonds, fruits and fruit spread - I would recommend this!  Maybe they should be a charcuterie and cheese bar rather than a wine bar ha.  

Service was spotty - one dude was one-word answer kind of standoffish and was quite pushy about opening a tab (hold on guy, we're not going anywhere and we're hanging out at the bar so it's not like we are going to run away) and the other dude was much nicer and friendly.  

I'm not sure I'll be rushing back here unless they make vast improvements in their red wine list being a wine bar and all.  Until then, I'll be checking out other places in the area.
author: Maile N.

description:
This is the cutest place EVER! Small, intimate, beautiful wood floors, dim lighting, and nice music. It feels like you're in someone's well decorated living room - perfect for catching up with a friend or going on a date. 

There's a small communal table in the middle, and seating at the bar/along the walls - it's limited though, so get there early!

They have both wine and beer ($3-$12 as far as I remember), and a cheese and charcuterie board. I had the cheese board ($15), and it was perfect - delicious fresh bread, 3 cheeses (mouth watering), almonds, apple slices, and almonds. 

I have no choice but to use this overly used phrase...this place is truly a "hidden gem!"
author: Jessica C.

description: This place is great at first glance, and that's not to say they don't provide a certain charm and hospitality.  The service is great, but honestly this place is a little claustrophobic around happy hour. I would suggest to the management that they seek out a larger space that can accommodate the rush crowd that comes with their well-earned "it place" badge.
author: Luis P.

description:
Neat fancy spot to take someone you want to impress with a tasty wine and ambiance. Hotspot for dates and tech company bros. 

Wine selection is neat and there are wines for just about anyone. Pours are nice and not stingy. Prices are a bit on the high side, but if you are not too worried about money- this is the place for you. 

Decor is cute and contemporary hipster aged wood chic. Taxidermy birds and a bunk bed are staple decorations. But I must mention when I was here it was already quite dark and it was hard to see anything. 
Clean bathrooms. Overall - nice place. Would go again. 

Especially good if you are a single girl and want to snag yourself one of those elusive tech bros.
author: Laima K.

description: A cozy, quiet place for a quiet beer or glass of wine: excellent selection of bottled beer. Really friendly barman who seems to know all the clientele. Feels like a home. No pretension.
author: Karl H.

description: Such a cute place. Wine was good, ambience was great, the cheese plate was delicious, and I loved the presentation of the wine flight. I'd come back and recommend it!
author: Emily F.

description:
Cute and cozy neighborhood gem tucked on Ivy Street in Hayes Valley. Fig & Thistle is casual, warm and inviting. There are about 3-4 seats at the bar, 4 tables that comfortably fit a pair at each, but if combined, can accommodate larger parties, or the cute lounge/couch like corner spot.

They do not have a kitchen so the food they serve will consist of Charcuterie or Cheese - the variety is good though and great for sharing! They also welcome you to bring your own food as long as it doesn't have a potent smell.

Good beer and wine selection - beers are by the bottle only (range $3-7 for small bottles and upward  of $20 if you get the large bottle which are great for sharing) but they have some wines on tap as well as wines by the bottle.

Overall - it's such a comfortable spot I'd pop in here for a drink  before or after dinner in Hayes Valley or simply catching up with a small group of friends anytime!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Cute wine bar and good music
great music on weekends too 
fyi - lots of hipsters
author: Marie r.

description: Great wine bar.  Very knowledgeable staff.  Gets a little noisy.  Not great for a first date....  Hit me up ladies.
author: Adam C.

description: This place is your neighborhood bar hidden in an ally. Super casual and very hippy, they only serve local beer and wine here no spirits. Which averaged about $5-10. Oh yeah they don't carry change so if you get a $10 beer and you only have a $20, either get another beer or tip them $10. Best way to pay is through CC. They ambiance is very hippy they have a bunk bed in which you can sit on, it's very small so if you plan on going here with 6+ people it'll be packed.
author: Mariethonnie M.

description: Super cute and the bartender was very nice. A girlfriend and I dropped in on a Sunday afternoon and it was the perfect spot to enjoy a few glasses of wine and spend a couple hours in conversation.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Cute little tucked away spot. Laid back. I sat the bar with my friend and it was really chilled on a weekday.

All of the wines are of California producers. I have to admit that I wasn't crazy about the wine list, tried a few of them, really liked the pinot noir (Krutz Family Cellar's 2009 pinot noir anderson valley) and the orange wine, but didn't really care for the rest.

The cheese selection was quite good.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Brilliant beer and wine bar with friendly staff and ever-changing menu. We had a couple of flights of 3 wines and different beers. Ask were tasty and well explained by the waitress.
author: Harry B.

description:
We went here while waiting for dinner on a Saturday night. The atmosphere is really cute and we ended up sitting at the bar. 

We met such great people! Behind the counter Bombin (hope I spelled it right) had amazing recommendations and the way they showcased the wine on the chalkboard wall was so cool! 

For sure a new spot for good wine and good people!
author: Meggan W.

description: Quaint wine bar in Hayes is great for meeting up a friend for a drink.  I've been her a couple of times now and love that it's cozy and never THAT crowded that you can't find a seat.  Super cute!
author: Meredith K.

description:
Tiny little wine & beer bar hidden in what feels like an alley (but I'm told is Ivy Street) in Hayes Valley.  Place is pretty cute on the inside with the converted "bunk bed" and the other dark wood tables and long bench seating against the other wall.

Went here at around 5pm to meet/catch up with a colleague of mine - had no problem getting a table by the window.

Wine and beer list is tightly "curated" so you're not going to find a huge selection - but there was plenty of variety for my taste and I enjoyed the rhone blend that I had. Also shared a plate of cheese, bread and fruit which was tasty - especially the cheeses which they rotate through various producers.

Would definitely go back again to grab a drink with friends.
author: Joshua B.

description:
Whenever I am in Hayes Valley, the name reminds me of Napa Valley.  I picture doses of small, wine vineyards or something along the lines of that sort.  Hayes Valley is a mini, cozy district, where there are hidden restaurants that is awaiting to be explored by simply walking in between discrete alleyways and going about.

Located in the middle of an alley, Fig & Thistle proves to be just that.  It is mellow on the outside and a great place to hide out from the main crowd if you are seeking a low key wine shop.

The inside is like an indoors patio lounge and there is some sort of charming feel to it.

They have a good variety on wine and some petite cheese, fruit, cured meat and cracker tidbits to order up and go along with it.

You just have to venture in to Fig & Thistle to see what I'm chattering up about.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I've been here a few times in recent months. It's a wonderfully intimate place to have an excellent glass of wine, if you can manage to find a seat. The wines are a bit pricey but are well worth every dollar!
author: Patricia D.

description: I don't understand this place. It looks like a cozy wine bar. It feels like a cheesy dance club. The music was so loud, it was difficult to talk. People were dancing, yelling and bouncing off the walls. Maybe it's something special on Thursdays? I don't know, but it sucked. I'll never go there again.
author: Jay G.

description:
I'm sadly disappointed with this spot after my latest visit. I've been a few times before and enjoyed myself - it's a really tiny place with fun decor and a good atmosphere. You order your wine (glass or bottle) at the bar and then chill. 

Well a few weekends ago I came here with several friends and the bartender was a real snob. The menu was smaller than I recalled (but that could just be me misremembering) and there weren't that many red wines to choose from. We decided on the Sangiovese and I went to the bar to order a bottle for us. The bartender said they were out, but that he had another wine he thought was similar. 

He poured me a tasting and I tried it and said it was good. He then starting pouring me a glass although I hadn't thought I actually ordered it. Okay, honest miscommunication since my "it's good" could have been interpreted that way. I told him that actually we wanted a bottle, but could he tell me the price first. It was $58 compared to $40 for the bottle we wanted originally. Now that's a pretty big price difference in my opinion, so I went to check with my friends and they agreed that we wanted something more affordable. I went back to the bar and asked him what other reds they had. I think he was annoyed because he's poured a glass of wine that I now didn't take. He asked me if price was the issue with the first bottle, and when I gave an honest "yes", he said we'd have a hard time because "you get what you pay for" - those were his exact words. 

Besides that being a rude thing to say to a customer, I actually find that absolutely not true with wine. Just because it's expensive doesn't make it better, particularly considering everyone's unique tastes. I've had $5 bottles of wine from Trader Joe's that were great and I've tasted $75 wine up in Sonoma that I didn't really care for. On top of that, a wine bar should only carry wine they consider good, regardless of price. I straight up told him that and he reluctantly agreed. I then gave up and ordered the Merlot which was the only other red under $50 - I'm not typically a huge fan of Merlot but this one was fine, so we hung out and drank it and overall had a good time enjoying each other's company.

Luckily by the time I went up to close my tab, it was a different bartender on duty. I seriously sighed with relief that I didn't have to deal with the first guy, because honestly he made me feel embarrassed and uncomfortable. Yes it's a wine bar but you don't have to be a judgmental snob and scoff when we don't want to pay for a bottle almost $20 more than the one you ran out of...seriously dude.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
My new favorite wine/beer spot in Hayes Valley. The place is essentially in alley and has a bit of a hidden gem feel to it as it is never too crowded, but is never empty.

The beer and wine menu is very tight and well pulled together. A nice selection of fine varietals to choose from, you'll always be able to fine a glass of vino to please you. For brews, they do a great job getting some small production beers so it's a treat to peruse the list. You'll be able to easily find a cerveza to quench your post work thirst.
author: Justin O.

description: This is a great place with amazing wines that you won't find anywhere else.  The owner Angel is extremely knowledgeable and generous.  My wife and I stopped by after work and had a fantastic time.  Highly recommend.
author: Larry H.

description: What a lovely little wine bar in Hayes. We really enjoyed ourselves here! Cute space with friendly bar tender (Angel). We will be back!
author: Brooke S.

description: In a city full of competition and great spots to drink... you think they'd hire people who give a s**t about their job and service. I'm not going to spend $15 a glass, plus tax, tip, etc... for you to point at the chalk board, while you surf the web... and have the balls to tell us we have get up and order from you. Seriously? You can't get off the iPad long enough to assist us? Get your priorities straight and drum up a little passion in your job. Sorry bro... no purchase and tip for you. We walked out of an already empty place. I will never go back. Too many other places that I'll spend my money.
author: Sally S.

description: It's cute and dark place to take a date. Bartender was very nice. Very crowded from a Thursday night.
author: Tiff W.

description: Fig & Thistle is a wonderful little gem. If you are looking for a casual wine bar with excellent choices in the Hayes Valley area this is your spot. The place has a no fuss appeal and the staff is extremely courteous and kind. I highly recommend and this could easily become a regular hang out.
author: rosita t.

description:
'Fig & Thistle'

Cute & Quaint - decor
Arm & (a) leg - cost
Good & Bad - bar tender annoying, non-alcoholic beverage selection can be better. Seating, good.
author: Me Iz S.

description: Tiny spot, but that really adds to the cozy, chill vibe which I love. Super friendly and knowledgeable staff who will help with your selection should you desire. I have found this to be a cool place to meet up with a couple friends for good wine and conversation. It can get crowded, so it's all about finding your right time of day - based on the experience you want. Highly recommend and can be found here often. :)
author: Karina B.

description:
A really nice addition to the neighborhood. A small wine bar right next to the new construction being built on Ivy - might be a little easy to miss if you are not looking for it. The staff is very welcoming and the owner is extremely nice. It is a small space so on a busy night I am sure that it will get a bit crowded. The wine and beer selection was limited for opening night, but good quality, so as they continue to operate I am sure that they will have more options to choose from.

Definitely a place to check out if you are in the area and grab a drink or two.
author: Frank J.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go to. 

Although it can get fairly loud and crowded but it has a really nice atmosphere. 

It's a really great intimate place for drinks.
author: Lena S.

description:
What a charming little spot! 

My wife and I wandered in after a night at the symphony (don't worry, we were just seeing Home Alone accompanied by a live score, it wasn't that fancy), and we were delighted. It's small and cozy. Just a few seats by the bar, a few tables, and an interesting bunk bed-cum-bench type thing. It's all very of-the-moment, with slate and reclaimed wood. I was also really happy that we were surrounded by other folks who weren't in their early 20s. It was slightly sophisticated, but definitely not stuffy.

The wine and beers are all Californian, and they have a bit map of the state drawn on the chalkboard, with arrows to point out where each selection is from. Amy and I enjoyed some bubbles from a super interesting flute that held at least double the normal amount, so I felt the slightly higher than normal price for a prosecco ($14) was worth it.
author: Allison S.

description: Came during the day for some snacks and wine and boy did I enjoy this place. Firstly, the decor inside was fantastic. Rustic, quirky, inventive, clean. Then the server was super nice, and gave me a great wine flight! A perfect spot to break up your shopping day in Hayes Valley!
author: Adam S.

description: Small, quaint space. Decent wine. Friendly and knowledgable staff.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
A brand new wine bar tucked away in an offstreet in Hayes Valley.  The bartender was very helpful with regards to wine recommendations and I ended up with a seriously excellent Teroldego from Santa Maria - never thought I'd find this varietal from a California winemaker!  Fig & Thistle serves a nice selection of draft beers as well for those more inclined towards hops and barley.  I haven't tried the food yet, but the cheeses and bread certainly looked tasty.

Quite the neighborhood gem and absolutely worth checking out especially if you have dinner plans at Jardiniere nearby!
author: Eric F.

description:
Nice bar to catch a drink before a ballet or such - atmosphere was pleasant and nice set up. At 7pm it was not too crowded and we were able to get a table with our party of 4. Big windows overlooking the street, nice for people watching. 
However, no choice of drink for the designated driver of the group - a pet peeve of mine when a bar doesn't have at least one or two options that don't contain alcohol. Our dd was left drinking water... 
The cheese and meat plate is mostly meat - three tiny little pieces of cheese: food is overpriced but drinks are good and at a good price. 
Other minus- not enough lighting in the bathroom. Impossible to tell whether the bathroom is clean when the lighting is so dim in there.
author: Anne M.

description:
Wonderful place! My son and his fiancée rented The Fig and Thistle for their reception. The wine and beer selections were excellent (beer geeks: I strongly recommend Boulevard's "The Sixth Glass" quad), and the cheese/charcuterie offerings make nice accompaniments.  The staff at The Fig and Thistle were very friendly and attentive. 

For any couple getting married at City Hall a few blocks away, I would highly recommend this place for a cozy, intimate place for a small gathering of friends and family.
author: Arthur C.

description: Expensive ($15+) glasses of wine, but adorable atmosphere tucked away on a side street in Hayes Valley. If you're mentally prepared for how expensive it's going to be, I think this is a pretty cute spot to take someone before dinner or even after dinner.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Like so many places in SF, this bar is teensy tiny. So here is what you can expect: First, you lurk around being creepy while waiting for someone to move off a spot. Then when you secure one, you're perched atop a tiny chair/ the bottom of a bunk bed/the side of a bench you happened to snag, elbow to elbow trying vainly to ignore other peoples conversations.

The beer selection is good, the wine looks well thought out (if spendy) and as you might have gleaned, this spot is not good for groups. They can't avoid the small space of course but for me, it's most likely never going to be a destination if you've got more than 3 people in your party. And I got the sigh and side-eye combination when asking for their wifi password so be warned.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Love that there's a new little wine bar in the neighborhood. We went there last week to check it out. It's small & intimate which is nice but the place is super loud. Most of the patrons were drinking beer, not a lot of people drinking wine. The staff was nice but after one drink we had to leave due to the noise level and headed over to Noir Lounge which is not noisy at all. 

Advice to owners, get some fabric draperies or something that will better absorb the sound. The concrete & wood design is overplayed in SF & the effect is high noise levels.
author: Giselle B.

description:
Cute and cozy wine/beer spot tucked away. The place looks like a converted house and there's even a bunk bed inside. 

I love the intimate feel to the place but the tables are too big for couples to really get close. My friend and I felt like there was a lot of distance between us. Make a move for the bottom bunk that's been converted into a bench if you want to be able to cozy up after a couple glasses of wine. 

Wine selection is great!
author: Winnie T.

description: Pompous, overpriced, lacking in humor. Asked for a wine with certain characteristics, but given totally different wine, without a taste first to make sure I'd like it. Go here if you got money to burn for expensive small pours and like humorless bartenders.
author: Michael K.

description:
First time here. Can't wait to come back. 

Walked in, and there were two seats waiting at the bar for me and my friend. Magical interior, so many delightful details in the decoration. Lovely place to talk and catch up with your good friend. Wonderful bartender, sweet and conscientious. And he makes the most amazing looking hot pastrami sandwiches. A fantastic night, complete with miniature cupcakes baked and left at the bar by the owner himself.

In love with Fig & Thistle.
author: Anna W.

description: I like coming to this place to have a glass of wine! its really chill and layed back. the service is great and ptices are very reasonable. I almost fell asleep on their bunk bed... haha
author: Christian D.

description:
We swinged by first time on a Saturday night when it just opened up. Totally cozy and it was almost empty with a couple tables filled only. BUT, it wasn't a bad thing! the cozy atmosphere was supposed to go with that kind of crowd with that kind of music. It's just a space you supposed to feel hidden and cozy, and thus the small street it resides on. And the beer selection was great too.  But would have given a 5 star just for the decor. . 

Came back couple weeks later, apparently the place had become the most happening place around. And you can hardly find any space to even stand. Filled with people, loud shouting and loud music. People are hanging out at the staircase, and the streets as there are already no space inside. The friend whom I wanted to show the place to thought I brought her to a frat party. Well, it was that kind of crowd with that kind of music. 

I felt it is a great thing for the business that they are doing well. But I hope they can keep to the vision and character that first inspire them to open the spot. With the decor you have got, this can't have been what you intend for.
author: Fung S. O.

description: Love, love love this tiny little wine bar.  Nice staff, nice selections, not too many choices - sometimes it is nice to let the experts narrow it down to their recommendations!  And they change the menu regularly.
author: C C.

description: Convenient location to a lot of other shops and eateries that are open late night (including Smitten ice cream!).  Chill atmosphere, not too dressy, and the bartender was attentive, helpful and willing to suggest (and pour generous samples) to help you decide on a wine.  Location is a little small but not cramped, the amount of seating is appropriate to the space.  Also not loud and good for a date night or place to have a conversation without screaming at each other.  Very enjoyable.
author: Anita T.

description:
I just love the atmosphere of this place. Perfect for a date or just catching up with friends. The first time I tried to go it was packed to the score (apparently Thursday nights are crazy b/c it's pastrami night) but this past Saturday it was nicely spacious with a good flow of people in and out. 

The bartender was really nice to my friend but pretty inattentive to me, either b/c he just liked her or b/c he was too busy chatting w/his friends when I was trying to order. But that interaction was like 3 minutes, so it didn't really affect my time there. 

Had the malvasia bianca per a yelper's tips and it was really good. A dry white but with a tinge of sweetness.
author: Rowena L.

description: Great intimate spot for wine or beer!  Mellow music and seating for ~20.
author: Nicci C.

description: Love Fig & Thistle. Nice, comfortable, cozy and great wines. Angel, Valentin, Baugman, and everyone here is so welcoming and knowledgable about what they are pouring. I make it a point to stop in whenever I am in the neighborhood and I always leave more impressed than my last visit. Brava, bellisima, check them out, you will not be disappointed!
author: Mark J.

description:
I finally paid a visit to this lovely bar and it did not disappoint.  The ambiance is casual and classy and it's a great place to go for a drink after work with friends (like I did) or for pre or post-dinner drinks if you're in the Hayes Valley area.  The owners (Nguey & Angel) are fantastic and did such a great job with the space!  I love the bunk bed and the mix of high and low tables - so fab :) 

The wine selection here is excellent - great mix of everything - red, white, rose, bubbles.  Also, the service is top notch - we loved the bartender!  She is so nice!. Snacks are yummy.  I mean, what more can you ask for in a wine bar?  


My friends and I will be making this a regular spot on our drinking list.  You should too :P
author: Cherlyn M.

description:
I came here recently for the first time with a couple of friends and really liked this place!  It's small and quiet so you can actually hear your friends talk.  Also, the space is decorated very cute so I think it's a great place to catch up with some girlfriends.

We thought the glass prices were a little high (no happy hour specials here) but the bottle prices were reasonable so we ordered bottles instead (woo woo for more wine lol).  We also ordered their cheese plate (I think this is the only food item?) which was also good.  

I would recommend giving this place a try if you're looking for a wine bar where you can actually have a conversation with your friends or date! :)
author: E M.

description:
Nestled in A petite Hayes Valley Alley,
Stumbling upon this gem will make you rally.

Cheese, beer and a bunk bed to play,
With lovely servers, this is a place to stay.

A variety of wine to choose from,
And a picnic table for your bum.

I hesitate to type this, 
and I know it isn't the nicest, 

but I hope others go else where,
A place like this in SF is rare.
author: Allyson D.

description:
Hayes Valley has a new gem. Hidden away in one of its little streets, Fig & Thistle offers a quiet space for you to enjoy a glass of wine and a few nibbles. It's a friendly, intimate wine bar that seats about 20, making it perfect for small groups or a solo trip. Angel and Francesca are warm and welcoming, and are eager to help you find a wine to your liking. 

They set me up with a dry riesling that was crisp and sweet without that over-honeyed taste. It went perfectly with the cheese platter that I ordered, which had a generous slice of truffle goat cheese, mini-baguette slices, almonds, fig jam, and thinly sliced apple. They have a pretty good beer selection as well.

It's a very simple set-up, but one that has obviously been done with a lot of love and it shows. Fig & Thistle is delightful, charming and is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood.
author: Racquel N.

description:
I was excited to try this place, but the hype I heard over the grapevine was over done I think... 
Interior is boring, artwork on the walls was laughable (sorry my peeps and I are all art school grads, we couldn't help critiquing it...), and it was TOO BRIGHT for an intimate little bar.

Wine and beer selection... you can find something similar at way more ambient and cozier craft beer/wine bars... 

If I was to hang here with a friend... it's alright, but the experience as a whole was just so meh... boring.
author: Kitty O.

description:
Just celebrated my 29th birthday and had an incredible time at Fig & Thistle! It was the perfect venue to hang out with a group of my close friends and enjoy each other. The wine and beer menu was delicious, the space was perfectly simple, laid back, and comfortable, and Nguey/Angel/Johnny/Chaz were amazing hosts. They were personable, social, and joined in on helping us celebrate. 

Thank you all for a GREAT birthday!!
author: julia s.

description: Smaller wine bar in Hayes Valley off the beaten path. This is somewhat a romantic spot especially at night and if you're lucky to grab the "bunk bed" :) Good selection of reasonable priced wines, friendly staff and really a perfect date place!
author: Beth P.

description:
Fig & Thistle is a hidden jewelbox of a bar. 

The focal point is a well-chosen, if esoteric, wine and beer selection, made accessible by the charming staff and good prices. Tasteful appointments, a cozy atmosphere, and a down-to-earth crowd round out the experience.  

It feels like a locals' bar, but caters to a surprisingly diverse set of SFers. 

For a clean new venue, it has a disarming patina that evokes 'lived-in mountain retreat meets seaside speakeasy.' Redwood tables and iron fixtures mix with sodium lights and denim drapes. 

If you're in the area, it's the perfect place to drop in for a spot (say, before or after a performance at the symphony), but the conversation and charming balance of sophistication and warmth may just keep you all evening.
author: Uly J.

description: I love this hidden gem of Hayes valley. A fun spot to try some delicious wines and learn about them! Sat at the bar and got some great service and information from one of the owners Angel! A must try if you're in the area!
author: Farrah S.

description: Cute, discreet wine bar hidden in Hayes Valley.  It's pretty small, but I went on a Tuesday night so we didn't have trouble finding a place to sit.  The wine is pretty good, and the atmosphere is really cute and intimate.
author: Cici A.

description:
To put it simply...

This place is dope. Super cozy. Wine/beer selection is top notch.

Lots of love to Angel and Nguey! :) Our LA/Seattle crews will be back to say what's up in the future.
author: Al L.

description: Cute small wine bar.  Didn't see any food menu, just beverages at the time we went.  Definitely a place to try and see if it is your style, but would prefer other wine bars in Hayes Valley with cocktails.
author: Candice H.

description:
Super cute spot for wine in Hayes!

The bartenders are really friendly and make great drink recommendations. Ambiance is chic casual, great for a date or a friend but not groups. The price points are comparable to other wine bars in the city, so on the pricey side but that's just wine in SF. They have a lot of quirky wines I haven't seen elsewhere, so fun to try new stuff here.

The one downside is that it's super small, so usually hard to find a spot to sit, and not big enough bar to stand by.
author: Marianne A.

description:
I heart wine bars. I heart charcuterie plates...even though they are always overpriced...I heart small wine bars. We visited this fig and thistle spot on a Friday night and cozied right up to the bar. Great gal served our cheese plate and we chatted for some time...then some guy walked in and posed as a bartender. He asked if we wanted to drink anything, which yes we did want to drink "something" at a bar. Our drinks and charcuterie arrive...charcuterie was ok...not so impressive over priced $22.00 charcuterie (note Jardiniere has a mind blowing $18.00 charcuterie!!!) anyway I digress. So back to weird male bartender...as we were sipping and eating he proceeds to open up the little plastic case that holds pickles and nuts and proceeds to stick his bare hands in and grab food to put in his mouth! Then every few minutes he'd grub some more. I guess he was hungry? Onto the bread... dips his bare hands In the bread container...man handles the bread grabs a few then chomps away! All in front of the patrons..5 min later he was talking to some other chicks at the bar then reaches over to the grape bowl and BAMN grabs a few and tosses in his mouth. I feel bad for the owner..I'm sure she would have had a mild coronary should she have seen her hungry employee grubbing with bare hands in the food tray. I never saw homie wash his hands from man handling the iPad to man handling the bread to later on after he had his hand in mouth preparing someone else's charcuterie!!! Gross! 

Maybe we'll go back for an expensive glass of wine..but who knows. And dude that serves beer and wine at this place...eat something before starting work!
author: Gigi G.

description:
This is my new FAVORITE wine bar. Terrific selection of wine and very reasonably-priced beer selection. Love their champagne cocktails too. 

The servers are knowledgeable, attentive, and super nice. They never make you feel like you're doing them a favor by being there. They'll spend time actually helping you find a wine you'll like. 

Love the chill atmosphere and the decor. How can you go wrong with a bunk bed and beautiful dark wood? The place is warm, inviting, and elegant without being pretentious. Terrific date spot and location couldn't be better. I'm quickly becoming a regular!
author: V V.

description: Tiny, dim-lit place: perfect to relax with a friend after a fast-paced day. Tried a chilled red-wine from the Sierra, interestingly good--try it!
author: Laure W.

description: Overall wonderful experience - great service and awesome wine with charcuterie plates. Defininetly a great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Jen D.

description: This place is AMAZING! We hosted our little reception there after we got married at City Hall in December, and everyone raved about it. It is such an intimate little spot. You step inside and easily forget that you are in the middle of the city. Angel and her staff could not have been more responsive and helpful. I felt like I had friends hosting a party for us. The wine and beer choices were wonderful. I'm so grateful to have found Fig & Thistle. I feel like the stars really aligned for us in finding them. GO NOW!
author: Marisa B.

description: Super chill place to hang with new people and old.  Great selection of beer and wine.   My favorite place in the city to hang!
author: Tommy E.

description:
This is a date spot wine bar hands down. The bottle of rose we had was so-so. (It was the Santa Barbara Groundwork). 

But I really loved the quaintness of  Fig & Thistle. I felt like I was going to my friend's house for a wine party.
author: Kris O.

description:
I gotta say... I LOVE THIS PLACE!
I come to to sf from sac about once a month to see an opera and it has become a ritual for me to go there after. Great location from the opera house/civic center.

The design inside is awesome. Really cool, relaxing, trendy without trying too hard, and an awesome bathroom! I really like the individual hand towels.. A very nice touch.

The staff have all been great. Very helpful, nice, and enjoyable to chat with.

The wine and beer selections themselves are also very well done. A good variety and all quality. Would definitely recommend this for a place to take a date.

Over all, you just can't go wrong. Looking forward on going back today!
author: James I.

description: So adorable, helpful staff and incredibly fun. I highly recommend the cheese platter :)
author: Rachel K.

description: As our first time in SF this was a really cool hole in the wall type place our friend showed us. It was really small/local and had a wine selection from across the state of Cali. They served food/beer as well, but we had already eaten and didn't want to feel bloated haha. It was very local and made you feel like one of their own. The bunk bed as a sitting area was a neat touch. It definitely has a hipster feel to it without much hipsters. Either way, if you're going to begin the night and don't mind tossing a bit of coin for some good wine, it's the place!
author: Josh M.

description: Great new addition to the neighborhood! Angel the owner is very educated, the wine selection is great and the pairing was perfect! Sweet atmosphere, clean and elegant design. Kudos!
author: Tarah O.

description: Oh dear! They ran out of basic charcuterie by 9 pm on a Friday night.  Okay wine but wouldn't say 'you have to come to here'.
author: Sharon L.

description: I loved this place. Very small and intimate. Dim lighting, great service, fantastic mood music, wine and cheese plate. Maybe I should write this as I don't want it to be busy!
author: Melody M.

description: seems cozy if it isn't Friday night. Loud and obnoxious. Decent wine list. If I were to go back, would be during the day. Try to avoid the poshy yuppies that move in herds...
author: Matt G.

description: Romantic and charming little spot with a nice wine list, all local I believe. The decor is rustic but inviting. The wines a bit expensive. Great for a date spot!
author: H L.

description: Charming place. Good music. I'm a regular because I live down the block. Can get really loud Because it's so small, but it's a relaxing place for beer or wine. No liquor. The owners showed up one night and bought us drinks out of no where, talk about customer service!
author: Matt D.

description: Cute and very cozy with an intimate feel. We went at the end of the night on a Saturday, thirty minutes before closing. The bartender was still very friendly and accommodating. We did have some delicious wine and enjoyed the quiet atmosphere.
author: Zara S.

description: Nice small, intimate space.  Wine and beer only. Prices are a bit higher than some other places, but I feel like wine bars are always a bit posh.  I arrived around 10pm on a Saturday night and all the seats were full.  The crowd was mostly people on dates or girls in their early twenties trying to be classy.  By 1045/11ish the place was half empty- very strange. I had one drink with my friend and decided to go somewhere a bit more upbeat. I'd definitely come back for an early evening drink or to catch up with an old friend.
author: Skye W.

description: Both times I've come here have been fun.  It's a cute little place to enjoy some wine or beer.  Interesting and good selections of both.
author: Andrea T.

description: Was lucky enough to stumble upon this adorable spot and loved it.  Their menu is great and the place is just so fun.  Will totally be coming back.
author: Amy P.

description: Love.  This.  Place !!! Must go 4 wine and beers !  Cheese plates r fab , their only food.  Cute seating area inside.
author: T L.

description: At first thought for my second return was... well, damnit if this place isn't one of my favorite places in the city that's top of mind but will be overwhelmed spilling out the door. Instead... Wednesday night my favorite place was exactly what I wanted. Rose. Close friends. The room's din at a level where we can hear each other. Imagine that. Real people. Talking. Face to face. Who knew!
author: Jon A.

description: The male bartender was unfriendly, almost rude.  The pours for a glass of wine are ridiculously small for the price.
author: Brooke L.

description: Wow, where do I start? I'll keep it simple bybsaying this place is so awesome!! I love the ambience here! The workers here were super nice and the customers here were also friendly. They have an amazing wide selection of wine that anyone will love. I will definitely be back with a group of friends!
author: Ivan T.

description: How could you go wrong with such a great hideaway. The selection if minimal but the atmosphere is fantastic! Met some great people here on vacation that I will never forget. ...and that bunk bed!
author: Gregg O.

description: My boyfriend and I came across this place after a dinner date one night. We heard alot good things from our friends, so we thought we should give it a try. To my surprise, they had a huge variety of wines to choose from. The staffs were so helpful and friendly. Plus, the ambiance is awesome here! I am planning to go back this weekend with my girls to try other wines on the menu!!
author: Vanill L.

description: Great neighborhood wine bar.  Very cozy - love the bunk bed seating on one side.  Wish they had more selection in terms of wines, though.  Also, loved that my grenache was "on tap" and therefore chilled to perfection.  The bottles they had out were a little warm.
author: B. Y.

description: Really cool little beer and wine bar in Hayes Valley.  They seemed to have a good selection of both...at least none of us complained about the options.
author: Dilly M.

description: It's a fine spot to go in and hang out with a glass of wine.  Seems a bit like they could use the space better for more seating/counter space/small bistro tables or something.
author: Lauren C.

description: Adore this place. I don't really want to write this review because I don't want you to know about this little gem I found. I want to keep all the tasty local brews and wines to myself. Everything on the menu is made in California. They have some really interesting stuff and it's all high quality. Go if you are looking for a relaxing space with refreshing drinks but please don't tell your friends.
author: Kelly C.

description: Very small with a limited selection might be bad things elsewhere but here they are an advantage. Very personalized service in a cute, cosy and inviting space. Just lovely, if a little expensive.
author: David H.

description: Nice, quaint low-lit place to relax and catch up w/ a friend or two.  The bartenders were courteous and knowledgeable as we asked for recommendations.  I'd come back for an after dinner or post-show drink.
author: Ron E.

description: Very cool ambiance - small intimate wine bar with good selection of beer and wine. Place probably holds 30 to 40 people and we went on weekday so it was great.
author: John L.

description:
Hiding behind an alley way on hayes straight...this place is a great place run by two rad owners.  Great selection of wine complimented by a nice cheese plate.  

Addendum: have gone two other times and just as great of an experience.
author: around town e.

description: I love this little bar. It's more then a bar, it's a destination, a gathering. Ideal to bring a date or friends or meet complete strangers, Fig and Thistle offers superb service in a cozy and elegant setting. The selection of beverages is well crafted with a great variety of Californian (& occasionally Oregon) wines and beers.
author: Sebastian V.

description: I was excited to try this place, but was a little put off by the sweltering temperature inside, and the extremely loud noise level. My husband and I stopped by on our way to the opera and were looking forward to a nice "date" spot... so I wanted to like this spot, but honestly neither of us enjoyed it. We left feeling overheated and rattled from having to yell to communicate with each other. Also, the prices were a bit too steep, in my opinion..
author: Jen R.

description: This place (Fig & Thistle) is the fuckin TITS!! An insane selection of wine and beer, complimented by a trio-selection of cheese dishes. The bathroom: modern, urban sleek black brick-tile decor with floral influence = cozy and pleasant. Also, real friggin hand-towels in the bathroom... NO paper towel waste from overuse by drunk folk; NO loud hand dryer that dries out your cuticles... Hand towels ppl. Enjoy!!
author: Collin C.

description:
This intimate wine bar is charming, has a great but small wine list, and best of all is not crowded! (Yet.) For its great location tucked just off Hayes st, this is a rarity. 

Friendly staff, nice atmosphere. Trendy hipster decor (library card catalogs, edison bulbs) but not overbearing. Good curated selection of wine and beer. They also have small plates which I haven't tried. Will definitely keep coming back, at least until it gets discovered and becomes completely overrun like the rest of Hayes valley.
author: Lauren D.

description: Hayes Valley just keeps getting better! Fig & Thistle is a boutique wine bar with excellent beers & cheese plates. Rustic wooden bar & tables & a fun bunk-bed to sit in while sipping on your choice beverage. Staff was very accommodating too.. Close to my work, even better;)
author: Blake P.

description: Wandered here for an after work drink and couldn't have been happier.  The bartender was knowledgeable and kind.  When another employee saw me waiting by the bar she asked what I was having and brought the drinks to the table.  The wine was delicious and unique.  The recommendations were on point.  It was a bit loud, but one of the better bars I have been to in San Francisco.  Small, charming with great service.
author: Erica C.

description: i love this place. i dont know the history of the location, but it looks like someone converted part of a small san francisco apartment into a bar and lounge area. it's got a really cozy and dimly lit atmosphere, creating little pockets of privacy despite the fact that this place can get pretty packed. they serve wine and beer only, but the selection is great. fantastic place to take someone on a date for drinks or while you're waiting for your table to open up at a nearby restaurant.
author: Clayton S.

description: Great little bar for a good conversation. Cosy, with friendly service and a pleasant ambiance, it's perfect for a low key night with friends.
author: Zari Z.

description: We were very impressed with this place.  It's small.  It's intimate.  It's friendly.  The wine and beer choices are very good.  The "wine flight" is a great idea and a very good price.  However, what really impressed us was the way they handled a problem that arose.  That is really the test of a well-run business.  We stopped by for a drink after the symphony, while we were waiting for dinner reservations at a nearby restaurant.  It was very busy and although our drinks came quickly, the kitchen was too backed up to get us our cheese plate in time.  So we cancelled it.  However, in the course of ringing up the cancellation, the bartender, who was swamped, made a mistake, and, not only did not cancel the cheese plate, but charged us for someone else's order that he was processing at that time.  The next day, I was looking at the slips and saw the error.  I immediately called and Angel gave me a call back that afternoon.  She looked into it and not only took full responsibility for the error, and reversed it, but "comped" us our entire order.  That's classy.  There was no "sorry, but you should have noticed -- nothing I can do" (which we SHOULD have looked!).  Just "we'll make it right."  We will definitely be back!
author: Betsey A.

description: what a neat place! we stumbled in on their 1st anniversary and met Angel who is all you'd want tin host, caring about the guests, and her touch on the place. Nice wine and beer list (all we had) but will be great to go back when we're in town. Congrats on your first!
author: bob o.

description: Wonderful wine bar, done very tasteful. Amazing wine selection, the owner/ bartender is so welcoming and sweet. This wine bar is great to get together with a group of friends, its not loud, perfect to catch up over yummy cheese plates. Love the location too!
author: SFlover D.

description: We were searching tirelessly to find a place to host a baby shower for about 20 people that wouldn't depend on the weather and wouldn't cost thousands of dollars, and as we almost lost all hope, we came upon Fig & Thistle. By now you know where it is and that it is cute and casual, but what you may not know is it's perfect for a smaller private event! We ended up with about 15 people, the space was perfect, bright during the day and the owner was SO nice and accommodating, let's just say the mom-to-be was in tears over how wonderful it all was. I highly recommend this place for the after work drink (it can get a little busy, but where isn't in SF these days?), or weekend wine and cheese, or for a private party if they're available. I'd absolutely host my next event there without doubt!!
author: Sara K.

description: my friends and i were walking around hayes valley after a day filled with delicious sf goodies. we were looking for a nice little bar to relax for a bit, and we stumbled upon fig & thistle. the wine list, although short, offered a wide range of selections. we got the cheapest bottle "matchbox" ($32) and posted up on a little bench with comfy cushions. the wait staff was extremely friendly and helpful and helped us pick the wine by letting us all taste it. the atmosphere was warm, quiet, and inviting. my friends and i want to live here!
author: Myles J.

description: Really loved that we stumbled upon this little gem.  Staff was great (all two of them), and they nailed it as far as ambiance goes.  Would like to have seen a few more food choices, but they explained it had something to do with licensing, so we opted for the cheese plate, which was very generous and delish!  Wine list was pretty great...would like to see a few more options.  Beer on tap would be nice, too, but not sure the small space/kitchen they have permits that.  Will definitely revisit this gem on my next trip to Hayes Valley!
author: Ariel D.

description: Fig & Thistle sets a standard for small, homey bars and would make a perfect night for a date. Seriously though, the interior is perfectly crafted and is very intimate while at the same time the staff knows there stuff. They have a very very well curated selection of wine and beers as well as a rotating list of small plates, which are all very reasonably priced. Do yourself a favor and impress your date by taking them here and you won't regret it!
author: Andrew L.

description: I had wonderful experience at this place. It is really cute and pleasant to be in, very friendly service, nice beer and wine selection. Enjoyed every minute of it--everyone should check it out!
author: y t.
